Yaiba-0.2.2: Implementation of Buchberger's algorithmsSource codeContentsIndex
Yaiba.Monomial
Description
At present, Mon ord is a list of integers (the multidegree of a monomial). It is not checked that the lists are of the same length when initialized. After initialization, all Mon lists are mostly-guaranteed to have the same length.

fromList :: [Int] -> Mon ordSource
Create a monomial from a list of Ints. Note that a monomial is always created with this funcction as a tuple, never with a Constant. In order to be used in the system, a term order must be supplied either now or at a later date
multiply :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> Mon ordSource
Multiply a pair of monomials. Warning: If a*b = 1, multiply does not return Constant, but a tuple of zeros
divide :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> Mon ordSource
Divide a pair of monomials. Warning: If a/b = 1, divide does not return Constant, but a tuple of zeros
showVar :: Int -> Int -> StringSource
maybeHead :: (Eq a, Unbox a) => Vector a -> Maybe aSource
Returns Just the head of a vector, or Nothing if it is empty
maybeLast :: (Eq a, Unbox a) => Vector a -> Maybe aSource
Returns Just the tail of a vector, or Nothing if it is empty
lexCompare :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> OrderingSource
Our implementation of comparing monomials lexically. For some reason, our implementation was better than the lexical comparison present in vector
grevlexCompare :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> OrderingSource
Compare a pair of monomials using the grevlex ordering
degree :: Mon ord -> IntSource
The degree of a monomial
isFactor :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> BoolSource
Determines if a is a factor of b
strictDiv :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> BoolSource
Determines if a is strictly a factor of b
isMon :: Mon ord -> BoolSource
Determines if the input is actually a monomial
lcmMon :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> Mon ordSource
Determines the lcm of the inputs
gcdMon :: Mon ord -> Mon ord -> Mon ordSource
Determines the gcd of the inputs
